snippet: The plans are expected to open a new chapter in a long and contentious debate over the future of a region that has become one of the nation’s busiest border crossings.
abstract: American and Canadian leaders will unveil plans for a new bridge linking Detroit and Windsor, Ontario, opening a new chapter in a long and contentious debate over the future of a region that has become one of the nation’s busiest border crossings; bridge will cost just under $1 billion and will be built through a public-private partnership.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and IAN AUSTEN
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Chicago, and Ian Austen from Ottawa. Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: The plans are expected to open a new chapter in a long and contentious debate over the future of a region that has become one of the nation’s busiest border crossings.

headline.main: New Detroit-to-Canada Bridge to Be Unveiled
headline.print_headline: New Detroit-to-Canada Bridge to Be Unveiled
